intro: Sabicea paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Sabicea, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub, adapting to the humid and shaded conditions of the forest floor. Sabicea paraensis plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small fauna.
